metadata.synopsis: The player can talk to Marhyah or Dringo to mention they found Scratch. Depending on who the player spoke to first, either Dringo or Mat'hyah will be the initial speaker.In either case, Mar'hyah will dominate the conversation.Mar'hyah wants to reclaim him as property of the couriers' office. The player can convince her to release Scratch, and potentially even to leave the kennels altogether. If they fail to persuade her, Scracth is locked up, and Oyster Boy can get fired.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Teleport to S_WYR_Posthouse_AngryMarhyah and speak with her.

7.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
7.context: NodeContext: A woman saying 'woof', not somebody actually barking. Looks at you with annoyance, and then shouts 'WOOF'. [Gwen Lee]

14.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
14.context: NodeContext: A woman saying 'woof', not somebody actually barking. Looks at you with annoyance, and then shouts 'WOOF'. [Gwen Lee]

20.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
20.context: NodeContext: A woman saying 'woof', not somebody actually barking. Looks at you with annoyance, and then shouts 'WOOF'. [Gwen Lee]

118.speaker: Player
118.context: NodeContext: A sore point between them

56.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
56.text: A charming effort - but you can't fool me.
56.context: NodeContext: A sore point between them

19.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
19.text: You're not a dog. So what the hell are you doing in my kennels?
19.context: NodeContext: A sore point between them

34.speaker: Player
34.context: NodeContext: A sore point between them

23.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
23.text: Unless you want me to shove you in one of these cages, stop barking and start speaking.

126.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
126.text: It's fine. I have a very robust sense of humour.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: I'd like to buy a dog.
127.context: NodeContext: A sore point between them

115.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
115.text: They're not for sale. These are courier dogs - trained to follow orders, read maps, and protect their deliveries with their lives.

113.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
113.text: They're worth more than their weight in gold.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I think I found one of your dogs - Scratch.
64.context: NodeContext: A sore point between them

86.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
86.text: Found him, did you? I can't say I'm surprised - Gomwick never kept him on a tight leash.
86.context: NodeContext: A sore point between them

117.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
117.text: Bring him here and I'll give him a once-over for you. Check him for worms and so on.
117.context: NodeContext: A sore point between them

13.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
13.text: Oh, yes please. I'd love to see him.

44.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
44.text: He's a good dog. We'd both love to see him again.

22.text: Scratch! It's good to see you boy.

46.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
46.text: Scratch! It's good to see you boy.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: raising a hand, ready to strike Scratch, who cowers and whimpers

48.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
48.text: Shut up, Dringo. And get back to work!
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: raising a hand, ready to strike Scratch, who cowers and whimpers

51.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
51.text: And you've been slacking as well, Scratch m'boy.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: raising a hand, ready to strike Scratch, who cowers and whimpers

73.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
73.text: This dog is property of Sword Coast Couriers. I'll take him off your hands now.
73.context: NodeContext: Like she's stating the obvious

85.speaker: Player
85.text: You shouldn't raise your hand to him like that.
85.context: NodeContext: Like she's stating the obvious

110.speaker: Player
110.text: I thought Scratch belonged to Gomwick?
110.context: NodeContext: Like she's stating the obvious

70.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
70.text: Gomwick was his handler, not his owner.
70.context: NodeContext: Like she's stating the obvious

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Is there any reward for returning him?
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch lies down sadlyNodeContext: heart-broken as he realises what's happening

92.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
92.text: You're lucky I don't report you for stealing him in the first place.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: He lives with me - you can't just take him.
128.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch lies down sadlyNodeContext: heart-broken as he realises what's happening

125.speaker: Player
125.text: He is not 'property,' he is Scratch. Don't you dare threaten him.
125.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch lies down sadlyNodeContext: heart-broken as he realises what's happening

15.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
15.text: I can do whatever I please - he's my dog. Now get out - this is a private yard.
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch lies down sadlyNodeContext: heart-broken as he realises what's happening

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I'm sorry Scratch, there's nothing I can do.
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch lies down sadlyNodeContext: heart-broken as he realises what's happening

99.speaker: Scratch
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch lies down sadlyNodeContext: heart-broken as he realises what's happening

21.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
21.text: That's more like it. Some obedience at last.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mar'hyah approaches Scratch, and ushers him into his kennel (cage). NodeContext: approving of Scratch's behaviour

11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch watches us through the bars of his cage. He is lost to us for now.NodeContext: Heartbroken

119.speaker: Scratch
119.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch watches us through the bars of his cage. He is lost to us for now.NodeContext: Heartbroken

69.speaker: Scratch
69.text: I don't want to be alone again.
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch watches us through the bars of his cage. He is lost to us for now.NodeContext: Heartbroken

33.speaker: Scratch
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch watches us through the bars of his cage. He is lost to us for now.

123.speaker: Scratch
123.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch lies down sadlyNodeContext: heart-broken as he realises what's happening

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I'll break every bone in your body before I let you hurt that dog.
84.context: NodeContext: nervous - not so cocky against someone her own size (so to speak)

9.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
9.text: You - you'll do no such thing.
9.context: NodeContext: nervous - not so cocky against someone her own size (so to speak)

134.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
134.text: You - you'll do no such thing.
134.context: NodeContext: nervous - not so cocky against someone her own size (so to speak)

104.text: And if you do, I'll call the guards. Who do you think they'll side with? The dog is my property.

131.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
131.text: And if you do, I'll call the guards. Who do you think they'll side with? The dog is my property.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: He's forgotten his training. He'll be a terrible influence on the rest of your hounds.
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs over to the player. The player pets him, relieved.

42.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
42.text: I'm not surprised. Gomwick always indulged him. And he's got a spark in his eye I don't like - looks lively.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs over to the player. The player pets him, relieved.

1.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
1.text: I'm not surprised. Gomwick always indulged him. And he's got a spark in his eye I don't like - looks lively.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs over to the player. The player pets him, relieved.

24.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
24.text: Take the useless mutt if you're so inclined. I'll have nothing more to do with him.
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs over to the player. The player pets him, relieved.

66.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
66.text: It's not just Scratch. She's always hurting the dogs.
66.context: NodeContext: Desperate, finally found someone to listen

52.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
52.text: Shut your mouth, Dringo. Last warning.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mar'hyah threatens Dringo, who's visibly scared of her

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I'm sorry, Dringo - I only care about Scratch.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs past Mar'hyah to the player. The player fusses him, relieved.

17.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
17.text: And now you have him. So get out of my kennels.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs past Mar'hyah to the player. The player fusses him, relieved.

78.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
78.text: As for you - that's a tenday's pay docked. Now, back to work.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I hear Lord Gortash abhors animal abuse. Perhaps I should report you to him.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs past Mar'hyah to the player. The player fusses him, relieved.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: You have lost your way, hound-keeper. Leave, before I teach you to respect these creatures properly.
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs past Mar'hyah to the player. The player fusses him, relieved.

0.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
0.text: Fine. You think you can do a better job without me - be my guest.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs past Mar'hyah to the player. The player fusses him, relieved.

47.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
47.text: Fine. You think you can do a better job without me - be my guest.

77.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
77.text: They're a useless bunch of mongrels. You're welcome to them!

41.text: How I run my kennels is none of your concern. Take your mutt, and get out of my yard.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs past Mar'hyah to the player. The player fusses him, relieved.

75.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
75.text: How I run my kennels is none of your concern. Take your mutt, and get out of my yard.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs past Mar'hyah to the player. The player fusses him, relieved.

130.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
130.text: As for you, Dringo. Get out of my yard. You're finished here.

59.text: Nothing a smack or three of the rod won't fix.

35.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
35.text: Nothing a smack or three of the rod won't fix.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: This noble beast has tasted true freedom - he will never be brought to heel again.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: You might be able to bully a dog and a boy, but threaten me and I'll snap you in two.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I suspect she mistreats the dog and you, boy. Is this true?

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Sorry Scratch, she's right. You don't belong to me.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Is this dog one of yours?

8.speaker: Player
8.text: You were being awfully harsh on the boy when I arrived.

67.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
67.text: It's the only way to teach him. He behaves worse than the dogs, and makes more of a mess.

45.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
45.text: Which means you're not a dog. So what the hell are you doing in my kennels?

27.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
27.text: Get out. I'm short-handed, in case you've forgotten.

28.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
28.text: I'll keep an eye on Scratch for you. Don't worry.

43.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
43.text: I hope that bloody dog bites you.

62.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
62.text: This is a private kennels. Get out.

93.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
93.text: I'm sorry for what happened. Scratch will be happier with you.

106.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
106.text: I should get back to work.

111.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
111.text: You - you got rid of her.

5.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
5.text: You - you got rid of her.

114.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
114.text: I'll do a better job looking after these dogs than she ever did. I promise.

36.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
36.text: Yeah. I'm caring for the courier dogs. Mar'hyah's my boss.

60.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
60.text: She's mean. But dad says she'll toughen me up.

96.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
96.text: She's an educator. She says if somebody doesn't listen, shout louder. And if they still don't listen, fetch the rod.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Your dad sounds like a smart man.

25.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
25.text: Maybe. I don't know. He's usually drunk.

80.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
80.text: And you - what do you want? This is a private yard.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I'd kill her and take her place.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: The harder you beat a dog, the more it bites back.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: True, boy, but only if you hone the anger she causes you. Make it sharp.

122.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
122.text: That's why I need to work hard in the kennels every day. To get tough.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: Sure she's not a bully? Abuse and strict training are far from the same, boy.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: That woman seems like a harsh taskmaster.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I think I found one of your dogs - Scratch.

87.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
87.text: Scratch! I thought he was dead.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Recognise this dog? I think he belongs here.
